choices.A: Getting or setting intrusion policies in FMC
choices.B: Creating an intrusion policy in FDM
choices.D: Getting the list of intrusion policies configured in FDM

discussion.content:
D is correct: 
Duration
 

This is a required parameter. All API queries should be accompanied with this parameter.

startdate=YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:00.000Z&endDate=YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:00.000Z

Aggregate report(s) for the specified duration. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/security_management/sma/sma12-0/api/b_SMA_API_12/test_chapter_010.html

agree that both A and D are required parameters according to documentation for both ESA and WEB reporting API.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/security_management/sma/sma12-0/api/b_SMA_API_12/test_chapter_011.html

The answer is actually A and D as both are required according to the docs.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/security_management/sma/sma12-0/api/b_SMA_API_12/test_chapter_010.html

It is D, Reporting APIs

This is a required parameter. All API queries should be accompanied with this parameter

I think the answer is A: device_type parameter

questions.question_text: Which query parameter is required when using the reporting API of Cisco Security Management Appliances?

choices.C: Configure the service using the /pxgrid/ise/config/profiler endpoint.
choices.D: Expose the service using the /pxgrid/ise/pubsub endpoint.
choices.B: Register the service using the /pxgrid/control/ServiceRegister endpoint.
choices.A: Look up the existing service using the /pxgrid/control/ServiceLookup endpoint.

discussion.content:
looks like D is indeed the correct answer. The pubsub service is used for registering/reregistering the service.
https://developer.cisco.com/docs/pxgrid/#!dynamic-topics/custom-service-provider

comments.content: 'Expose' is not used in terms of providers registering a service, a keyword 'Publish' is used when utiizing pubsub endpoint. However, as a provider, you definitely need to use pxgrid.control.ServiceRegister to register the resource - hence, B

questions.question_text: Which URI string is used to create a policy that takes precedence over other applicable policies that are configured on Cisco Stealthwatch?

discussion.content:
Bearer, ips/10.10.20.50, latest_domains
My understanding is when %YourToken% is Bearer, when %base64string% is Basic.
